definition[0]: if something skews the results of a test etc, it affects them, making them incorrect
example[0]: All the people we questioned lived in the same area, which had the effect of skewing the figures.
definition[1]: to affect or influence someoneâ€™s ideas, actions, or judgment, especially in a way that makes the ideas etc not correct or fair
example[1]: These assumptions about Communism skewed American foreign policy for decades.
